special_features: Commentary by Frazer Hines, Wendy Padbury, Giles Block, Arthur Cox and Sylvia James
Recharge and Equalise - Cast and crew look back on The Dominators
Coming Soon Trailer - Revenge of the Cybermen & Silver Nemesis
Scottish Falsetto Sock Puppet Theatre (Catalogue Doctor Who)

notes: Originally a six-part story, edited down to five episodes
Derrick Sherwin re-wrote the script with Terrance Dicks
Haisman and Lincoln requested the pseudonym 'Norman Ashby'
Episode 3 was recorded on 35mm black-and-white film
Quark voices provided by Sheila Grant
Jelly babies debut in Doctor Who
Quarks were created to be the next merchandisable monster after the Daleks

continuity_notes: The Doctor cites this story as an example of his fight against evil when on trial before the Time Lords in The War Games
The Quarks later appeared in TV Comic and the Lethbridge-Stewart book series

plot.plot_summary: The Second Doctor, Jamie and Zoe land on the planet Dulkis, where two Dominators and their robot servants the Quarks have arrived to drain the planet's resources. The pacifist Dulcians are reluctant to resist, but the Doctor and his companions try to inspire them to stand up to the invaders. After various tests and confrontations, the Doctor manages to sabotage the Dominators' plan to destroy the planet, causing their ship to explode.

The Dominators, Navigator Rago and Probationer Toba, land on the Island of Death on Dulkis and begin drilling into the planet's core to extract radioactive material to refuel their ship. When the Doctor, Jamie and Zoe arrive, they discover the Dominators and their robot servants the Quarks. The pacifist Dulcians, including Cully, Balan, Kando and Teel, are reluctant to resist the invasion. The Doctor and his companions try to stop the Dominators' plans, leading to a battle of wits and confrontations with the Quarks. Eventually the Doctor manages to sabotage the Dominators' plan by placing the seed device on their ship, causing it to explode just as it is taking off, saving Dulkis from destruction.

The Dominators plan to drop a radioactive seed into Dulkis' core to refuel their ship. The Doctor, Jamie and Zoe try to inspire the pacifist Dulcians to resist the invasion, but they are reluctant. The Dominators capture the Doctor and Jamie, subjecting them to intelligence tests. Cully and Zoe attempt to gather evidence of the Dominators' presence. The Doctor discovers the Dominators' plan to drill into the planet's core and detonate a seed device to create a volcano. In the climax, the Doctor manages to place the seed device on the Dominators' ship, causing it to explode as it takes off, saving Dulkis.

In the finale, the Doctor manages to sabotage the Dominators' ship, causing it to explode as it takes off, saving Dulkis from destruction.
